channel.title: request on Miranda Zhang's Website
channel.description: Recent content in request on Miranda Zhang's Website

item.title: Bay Area Wishlist
item.description:
I have a GDoc with things-I-want-to-do in the Bay Area! I would be excited to do these with friends, so please see if you’d be interested in joining me to do any of these!

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1CQwZ-XOcRDBXu1ZI6F_BwAj6q4ZjbLl8icndcpbMpwM/edit?usp=sharing

(context below)

~ request for collective hivemind thoughts ~

I’m worried about how best to address my burnout before my OPT unemployment ends in mid-August and I would appreciate suggestions for any of the below approaches

  1. In one month, make a really concerted effort to tackle my burn-out. This may include
  • going on a short nature retreat (is there some way I can do this for ~free?)
  • doing Focusing (who can teach me?)
  • cuddle sessions (I should probably schedule these)
  • going nuclear (i.e., withdraw from EA for the month)
  1. Leave the US until I’m ready to work

Really undesirable because I like the people and environment here! Possibly mitigated if I can actually come up with things I’d be excited to do. Less likely: staying with my parents. More likely: staying with my friends

Soooo is there anyone who’d be willing to let me stay at theirs for ~.5-1 month? I imagine the UK is going to be the likeliest candidate

item.title: Want to test your fit for AI technical safety research with me?
item.description:
I’m open to a variety of options, whether a couple hours over several days or a weekend ‘retreat!’ (I’m kind of psyched about the retreat option, which is probably just crashing a group house)

I keep saying that ‘I should (and will) test my fit for AI technical research,’ but actually doing this seems increasingly aversive. So, here’s an open call to my non-technical (and technical, if you enjoy watching your friend(s) struggle) friends to spend a day testing our fits for AISTR!

I was thinking we could try finding solutions for ELK or follow Holden Karnofsky’s advice in this post: https://forum.effectivealtruism.org/.../important…

(context: me having blocked out the entire day to do this, and feeling worried I’m going to give up halfway through)

item.title: ðŸ”ˆopen call for constructive criticism!
item.description:
like a doom circle but anonymous and just for me and not isolated to my impact potential, i guess?

I’m trying to stop striving to “be the best,” and part of that involves learning to take criticism better. So, I’m putting out a call to submit (anonymous, if you’d like) criticism for me! If this goes well, maybe I’ll make this a regular thing. We’ll see : )

Admonymous | Google Form
